alert.note: Alert for Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued December 27 at 2:37PM PST until December 27 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THURSDAY TO 7 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the first Wind Advisory, south winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. For the second Wind Advisory, southeast winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. * WHERE...The southern Rogue Valley in Jackson County along Interstate 5 between Ashland and Medford, and the foothils of the Cascades. * WHEN...For the first Wind Advisory, until 7 PM PST this evening. For the second Wind Advisory, from 7 PM Thursday to 7 PM PST Friday. Winds will gradually diminish this evening, then increase again Thursday. Winds will reach advisory strength again Thursday evening and remain strong through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
